"The Pianist" is a historical drama that tells the story of Wladyslaw Szpilman, a Polish musician who was one of the key figures in the history of music. The movie follows the story of Wladyslaw Szpilman and his family during the Holocaust. 

"Lincoln" is an American biographical drama film directed by Steve Spielberg that tells the story of Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, who played a crucial role in the history of the United States. The movie follows the story of Abraham Lincoln and his family during the American Civil War and its aftermath.

The Godfather is a cinematic masterpiece that has stood the test of time and continues to be enjoyed by audiences around the world.
2) "The Shawshank Redemption" (1994) directed by Frank Darabont is a highly acclaimed drama film that follows the life of Andy Dufresne, a man who serves 25 years in prison at Shawshank State Penitentiary, a maximum-security federal penitentiary located in Terre Haute, Indiana.
Starring Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne, Meryl Streep as warden Ruth Deitz, Bob Gunton as fellow inmate Brooks Hatlen, William Sadler as fellow inmate Joe Pesci, and James Whitmore as warden Henry Deitz.
The Shawshank Redemption is a highly acclaimed drama film that has won numerous awards including Academy Awards for Best Picture, Best Director and screenplay, Golden Globe Award for Best Picture, Best Director and screenplay, and Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Ensemble.
